label: Virus reassortment inference software.
description: TreeSort infers both recent and ancestral reassortment events along the branches of a phylogenetic tree of a fixed genomic segment.

parameters.label: Clades path
parameters.desc: Path to an output file, where clades with evidence of reassortment will be saved

parameters.label: Path to the descriptor file
parameters.desc: The descriptor file provides paths to the alignments and phylogenetic trees for different virus segments

parameters.label: Deviation
parameters.desc: Maximum deviation from the estimated substitution rate within each segment. The substitution rate on a particular tree branch is allowed to be twice as high or twice as low as the estimated rate.

parameters.label: Equal rates
parameters.desc: Do not estimate molecular clock rates for different segments: assume equal rates. Ignored if timetree is specified

parameters.label: Inference type
parameters.desc: Should the reference phylogeny be built using FastTree (fast, low quality) or IQ-Tree (slower, high quality)?

parameters.label: Input FASTA file ID
parameters.desc: The ID of a FASTA input sequence in the workspace

parameters.label: Input source
parameters.desc: Is the input a FASTA sequence or the ID of a FASTA file in the workspace?

parameters.label: Is time scaled?
parameters.desc: Indicates that the reference tree is time-scaled (e.g., through TreeTime)

parameters.label: Match on "EPI_ISL_XXX" field
parameters.desc: Similar to "match on strain", but here segments are matched based on the "EPI_ISL_XXX" field (if present in deflines)

parameters.label: Match on RegEx
parameters.desc: Provide your own custom regex to match the segments across the alignments.

parameters.label: Match on strain?
parameters.desc: Match the names (defined in FASTAs) across the segments based on the strain name. E.g., "A/Texas/32/2021" or "A/swine/A0229832/Iowa/2021". Works for flu A, B, C, and D. This way no preprocessing is needed to standardize the names before the analysis.

parameters.label: Method
parameters.desc: Methods are "local" (default) or "mincut". The "mincut" method always determines the most parsimonious reassortment placement even in ambiguous circumstances

parameters.label: No collapse
parameters.desc: Do not collapse near-zero length branches into multifurcations (by default, TreeSort collapses all branches shorter than 1e-7 and then optimizes the multifurcations).

parameters.label: Output path
parameters.desc: Path to the output file (tree will be saved in nexus format)

parameters.label: P-value
parameters.desc: The cutoff p-value for the reassortment tests: the default is 0.001 (0.1 percent). You may want to decrease or increase this parameter depending on how stringent you want the analysis to be.

parameters.label: Segments
parameters.desc: The segments to be analyzed. If you want to analyze all segments, leave this field empty.
